basics.name: Mike Dupuis
basics.label: Research Engineer, MASc, PE (California), PEng (British Columbia)
basics.summary: I am a data scientist, engineer, and signal processing specialist who develops software, data processing pipelines, novel algorithms, and neural networks with real-world applications. I have 14 years of industry and research experience in Python programming, signal analysis, and engineering, applying academic insights to industry needs through software development. I'm currently based in Davis, California, working full time as an analyst and engineer.

work.name: Geosyntec Consultants Inc.
work.summary: Technical lead and analyst in seismic hazard studies, ambient vibration testing, and quantitative risk analysis for dams and levees.
highlights: Developed a neural network model using TensorFlow for seismic site characteristics prediction.
Performed operational modal analysis for dams and levees using Python.
Quantitative risk analyses of concrete gravity dams using state-of-the-art tools.

work.name: BC Hydro
work.summary: Lead seismic studies and structural analysis of dams using advanced tools.
highlights: LS-DYNA modeling and analysis of concrete gravity dams.
Ground-motion time series selection and optimization.

work.name: Read Jones Christoffersen Ltd.
work.summary: Design engineer for concrete, steel, and timber structures, and seismic time-series analysis.
highlights: Designed structural elements for libraries, transit hubs, and towers.
Conducted seismic response spectrum analysis using finite-element models.

education.summary: Thesis: Seismic performance of buildings with permanent lateral demands.

projects.name: Exploratory Record Toolbox
projects.summary: Developed a Python-based tool for signal processing analysis featuring an intuitive GUI and API for data visualization and figure generation.

projects.name: Structural Design Package
projects.summary: An educational Python-based software for structural design checks and pdf report generation.
